name: Avoid using 'java.io.File'
description:
Java artifacts should not use 'java.io.File' for application deployed on a Web Server or an Application Server to avoid any kind of dependencies with deployment environment of your application

This rule is computed only when web.xml or ejb-jar.xml file are present.
output:
This report lists all java artifacts using 'java.io.File'.
It provides the following information:
 Artifact full name
rationale:
For portability reasons, in Web applications or Application Server, 'java.io.File' should not be used since it means giving an absolute path and therefore being dependent on the environment where the application is deployed.

Also, a program violates the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification by using the java.io package.
sample:
File f = new File(request.getParameter("fileName"))

---------------

File f = new File(configPath + "avatar." + request.getParameter("extension") )
alternativeName: Prefer not using 'java.io.File' to avoid violating the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) specification
